name: Spaghetti Bolognese
keywords: Spaghetti Bolognese, Italian cuisine, pasta dish, beef mince, tomato sauce, red wine, onion, carrot, celery, garlic, thyme, main course, family meal, comfort food, easy recipe, slow simmer, rich sauce, hearty, traditional, European food, savory
description: A classic and hearty Spaghetti Bolognese recipe featuring slow-simmered beef mince in a rich tomato and red wine sauce with aromatic vegetables and herbs.

recipeInstructions.text: Fry beef over high heat and get a good fond forming on the bottom. Take the beef out and saute onion, celery and carrot in olive oil until softened, about 20-30m. Take it low and slow. Make sure to scrape the fond off through that process.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry Onion and Beef

recipeInstructions.text: Add everything and simmer for 1-2h depending on how thick you want the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer

recipeInstructions.text: Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve up with spaghetti and parmesan.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: I love to serve it up with fresh chili or mix some dried chili flakes through before simmering to give it a good kick.
Also great with melty cheese like mozzarella.
